website_summaries.verdict: The Amped RE1300M Wi-Fi Range Extender lets you fill dead spots in your home at a bargain price, but if you plan on taxing your network, it's worth investing a bit more for a speedier model.
cons: Middling MU-MIMO and long-range throughput performance

customer_reviews.title: Has been working beautifully with multiple Ring floodlight & computers wirelessly connected to this device.I would Buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Has been working beautifully with multiple Ring floodlight, doorbell and other devices without issue for a 1600+ sq ft. home. Very easy to set up too. I highly recommend this unit and hoping it will last for a few years. Update March 8th 2018 over 5 months later and still working beautifully without any issues. I would buy it again... Update August 25th 2018 and nearly a year later and still going strong with no issues and would most certainly buy it again. It is a true extender...
customer_reviews.author: mona

customer_reviews.title: Mine is probably just faulty.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box it did not work. The power connection was finicky and I needed to cut off part of the power cord and resplive it together just to get a stable power application. Once I got it powered up the signal strength as great, but I couldn't use it as I intended becaise the network I was repeating requires you login via a splash screen. This device won't repeat that signal allowing to me login from my computer. It wants to be logged into the network in order to repeat it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my older wireless extender (Amped wireless sr10000). My older one I have to reset it often but it still out performs this new one. So I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: B-Rad

customer_reviews.title: will not buy this from this manufacturer no more bad product. looks cool tho that why i got ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this January and it broke already , got one last June and that one broke in December too , will not buy this from this manufacturer no more bad product . looks cool tho that why i got it and when it broke the first time , i think it was just a bad one from the lot , but after two will not recommend at all
customer_reviews.author: phillip D

customer_reviews.title: Solid company w pretty good products at affordable prices
customer_reviews.text: Second Amped Wireless router I've bought because these provide wired jacks from a wifi source. Not overpriced like Netgear and other major names. And their tech support is better than the big boys. Wifi strength is about 70% of what they claim thou. Buy the strongest one.
customer_reviews.author: Allison E.

customer_reviews.title: Okay for now
customer_reviews.text: So far, this dual band extender is doing a great job, runs 24/7 without failure. At this time of the review, it is only a couple months old. Previous Amped extenders were failing after about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the product is good. Easy to install. However, it should be made even easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mukesh Garg

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Signal gain was minimal and did not meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful on the extended side as expected.  Works otherwise if not too far away.
customer_reviews.text: Not as powerful on the extended side as expected. Works otherwise if not too far away.
customer_reviews.author: P. Grove

customer_reviews.title: works well, strong signal, easy to configure, extends existing wireless network, software could use an update, worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: works well, strong signal, easy to configure, extends existing wireless network, software could use an update, worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Perspectech

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is better than most as far as a wifi extender. My home is not huge and it did bring in the wifi to the farthest end of the home. Not real strong, but strong enough to run Netflix in that room. No other extender has been able to do that and I have tried many. Consistent wifi also. Easy setup and instructions. Expensive, but worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product! It makes all of my devices work ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It makes all of my devices work in my tri level condo. Super easy to set up also if you can follow step by step directions. Can't get any easier. A+
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not one verified purchaser? Hmmmm. Here's a one-star for balance.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

product_meta.title: Amped RE1300M Wireless Artemis-EX, High Power AC1300 Wi-Fi Range Extender with MU-MIMO
product_meta.description: The ARTEMIS-EX is a powerful range extender, specially designed for multi-device households. Built with a powerful quad-core processor, 8 High power amplifiers, and 2 High gain antennas, the ARTEMIS-EX delivers up to 12, 000 square Feet of additional Wi-Fi coverage. It is engineered to provide unmatched range and reliability for the most demanding networks with many connected devices. Ultra-fast AC1300 Wi-Fi technology provides up to 399Mbps 2.4GHz speeds and up to 866Mbps 5GHz speeds, making lag and buffering things of the past. The ARTEMIS-EX also features cutting Edge MU-MIMO technology that enables multiple devices to receive data at once, granting uninterrupted streaming for all. Get rid of your Wi-Fi dead zones, stream movies and shows with ease, and be free with your mobile devices. Whole-home Wi-Fi coverage is here, with the ARTEMIS-EX.
feature_bullets: Extend the range of any Wi-Fi for up to 12,000 sq ft of additional coverage with 8 high power amplifiers and 2 high gain antennas
Ultra-fast AC1300 Wi-Fi speeds allow you to game without lag and stream HD and 4K media to multiple devices at once without buffering
Multi-User MIMO delivers optimal performance when many devices are connected at once, unlike standard extenders that can only deliver data to one user at a time

USB 3.0 port allows for rapid file sharing, 5 gigabit ports to bridge in your wired devices like Smart TVs and gaming consoles, and the universal design enables it to extend any router.Comes with Elite Support, Amped Wireless' free, US based, in-house, technical support

NOTE:The RE1300M supports all Wi-Fi standards that are compatible or backwards compatible with 802.11a/b/g/n/ac Wi-Fi.Also kindly review the videos under the image section and user manual under product details for set up and user guidance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars25 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
